articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Brazilian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Conveys Sympathy to Brazilian President
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of sympathy to President of Brazil Dilma Vana Rousseff in connection with the flood and landslide caused by the torrential rain that hit the southeastern part of the country, claiming huge casualties and material losses.
					 Kim in the message expressed deep sympathy and condolences to the president and, through her, to the residents in the afflicted area.
					
					The message expressed belief that the President and government of Brazil would eradicate the aftermath of the natural disaster and bring the living of the afflicted people to normal as early as possible.

articles.title: S. Korea Urged to come out for Dialogue and Negotiations at Early Date
articles.content:
S. Korea Urged to come out for Dialogue and Negotiations at Early Date
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Dialogue and negotiations are the only way for improving the inter-Korean relations and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country. The south Korean authorities should come out for dialogue and negotiations at an early date in response to the DPRK's proposal. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a by-lined article.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations are the only just way for independently solving the issue of country's reunification by the concerted efforts of the Koreans, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 No issue can be solved by way of confrontation. This is proved by the last three years of confrontation between the north and the south.
					
					Only when the responsible authorities of the north and the south holding real power hold candid talks to wipe out misunderstanding and distrust is it possible to improve the inter-Korean relations, clear the atmosphere of hostility and pave the way for cooperation and peace. 
					
					 There are a lot of good precedents in which the north and the south narrowed down bilateral differences and successfully weathered difficulties through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 Had the north and the south defused confrontation through dialogue and negotiations last year, the situation on the Korean Peninsula would not have remained so tense as now.
					
					 How to approach dialogue and negotiations is a touchstone distinguishing patriotism from treachery and peace from division.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities wish to see the inter-Korean relations improved, without playing into the hands of foreign forces keen to do harm to the destiny of the Koreans, they should come out for dialogue and negotiations without any precondition.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Aim Sought by S. Korea-Japan Military Cooperation
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Aim Sought by S. Korea-Japan Military Cooperation
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Defense ministers of south Korea and Japan at the talks on Jan. 10 blamed someone's "provocations" and discussed the issue of establishing a "close cooperation" system to cope with them.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 South Korea is tightening in real earnest its military nexus with Japan, covering up its crime-woven past. This is little short of paving the way for Japan's reinvasion.
					
					 This is, at the same time, an act of vitiating the atmosphere of dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south and harassing peace and security of the region.
					
					 Japan has worked hard with bloodshot eyes to secure a legitimate pretext for its military overseas expansion. To cite an example, some time ago the Japanese prime minister openly expressed his intention to discuss the issue of dispatching "Self-Defense Forces" to the Korean Peninsula to rescue Japanese in "contingency."
					
					 The recent military talks held between Japan and south Korea were obviously aimed at putting into practice the former's scenario for staging a comeback to Korea. Such sophism about someone's "provocations" and the like let loose at the talks were just rhetoric to cover up its sinister purpose. Japan is now availing itself of the mounting tension between the north and the south to prod the south Korean authorities into laying a springboard from which it can stage a comeback to Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities are turning their eyes away from the goodwill offer from fellow countrymen while unhesitatingly tightening the nexus with the Japanese reactionaries keen to launch a war of reinvasion against the Korean nation.
					
					 If they are interested in the improved inter-Korean relations and peace on the peninsula even a bit, they should give up military cooperation with foreign aggressors, an act quite contrary to dialogue.

articles.title: Imperialists' Aggressive and Predatory Nature Remains Unchanged
articles.content:
Imperialists' Aggressive and Predatory Nature Remains Unchanged
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The imperialists are now talking a great deal about "peace" and "economic prosperity." They claim that without them is it impossible to settle any international dispute nor is it possible for the developing countries to achieve development in the new century. These remarks are, however, nothing but sophism to cover up their wild ambition for aggression, plunder and domination.
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 If there be imperialism not seeking aggression and plunder, it is no longer imperialism.
					
					 The imperialists pretend to be "peace champions." But this is just a crafty and cunning art of disguise to benumb the world people's awareness and achieve their aggressive and predatory purposes. It is their general strategic goal to destroy the world independent forces with their policy of strength, war strategy, turn the international community into a "unipolar world" dominated by them and exercise an unlimited right to domination.
					
					 The aggressive nature of the imperialists remains unchanged and it is getting more pronounced as the days go by. This is clearly proved by the disastrous wars that have taken place in the international arena since the demise of the Cold War.
					
					 The "security" and "anti-terrorism" touted by the imperialists are a synonym for aggression, war and military intervention.
					
					 The economic crisis like financial crisis and resource crisis now sweeping all over the capitalist world is further stirring up the imperialists' greed.
					
					 The main thrust of the present world strategy of the imperialists is to get a monopoly of resources.
					
					 They are making their ways deep to other countries under the pretext of "joint development" and "assistance" in a bid to loot more natural resources.
					
					 The developing countries are the main targets of their plunder.
					
					 To have illusion about the imperialists and compromise with them without principle, failing to have a proper understanding of their real nature is little short of playing into their hands.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Working Hard to Tighten Military Nexus
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Working Hard to Tighten Military Nexus
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress in south Korea in a statement on Jan. 11 accused the present "government" of working hard to tighten the military nexus with Japan watching for a chance to stage a comeback to Korea.
					 The statement recalled that south Korea held talks with Japan at which they agreed to boost the bilateral military cooperation for "taking a joint action against the north."
					
					 Japan can never become an object with which south Korea can cooperate as the former is openly revealing its ambition to grab Tok Islet and screwing up military tension in Northeast Asia, far from making apology and reparation for its past aggression, it held.
					
					 It urged the authorities to immediately halt the military cooperation with Japan, disturber of peace.
					
					 Meanwhile, a spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on Jan. 12 demanded the authorities halt the military tie-up with Japan.

articles.title: US-S. Korea's Military Provocations Assailed by Indonesian Figure
articles.content:
US-S. Korea's Military Provocations Assailed by Indonesian Figure
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The military provocations committed by the U.S. and the south Korean authorities pushed the situation on the Korean Peninsula to an extreme pitch of tension, said Ristiyanto, general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia, in a statement on Jan. 10.
					 A new war could be averted on the Korean Peninsula thanks to the patience of the DPRK, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The joint statement of the DPRK's government, political parties and organizations proposed having talks between authorities having real power and responsibility unconditionally and early. It called for discussing and settling all the issues related to the important affairs of the nation.
					
					 He hailed the important proposal of the DPRK as a fair and aboveboard one to defuse the tension on the Korean Peninsula and protect the interests of all the Koreans.
					
					 He expressed hope that this proposal would be put into practice to deliver the Korean Peninsula from all sorts of war danger at an early date and create an atmosphere of peace in this region.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Dialogue and Negotiations Favored Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Dialogue and Negotiations Favored Abroad
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Dialogue and negotiations are only the way for weathering the difficulties at present when the north-south relations are at the lowest ebb and the danger of a war is on the daily increase, said the South African Association of Friendship and Solidarity with Korean People in a statement on Jan. 9.
					 The statement continued: 
					
					 The July 4 joint statement in which the three principles of national reunification--independence, peaceful reunification and great national unity--were clarified and the June 15 joint declaration based on the idea of "By our nation itself" and the October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing it, were adopted and published through dialogue and negotiations between the north and the south.
					
					 We hold that the north and the south of Korea should keep alive this valuable experience and thus weather the present difficulties and usher in a new phase of independent reunification through wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 We will as always fully support the just proposals for peace on the Korean Peninsula and its reunification and make every possible effort to put into practice the proposal of the DPRK's government, political parties and organizations.
					
					 The Sweden-Korea Friendship Association in a statement on Jan. 10 fully supported the joint statement of the DPRK's government, political parties and organizations, sincerely hoping that the north and the south of Korea would jointly seek a way of dialogue, detente and peace, stressed the statement.

articles.title: Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of National Reunification Supported
Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Officials of Guinea and Egypt supported the Korean people's cause of national reunification.
					 The June 15 North-South Joint Declaration is a landmark of Korea's reunification and an immortal banner hailed and supported by not only the Koreans but the whole world, said Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, in a statement on Jan. 7.
					
					 He said:
					
					 The basic principle of the settlement of the issue of Korea's reunification is national independence but it does not mean that the international community should sit on the fence over the issue.
					
					 It is an important duty of the international community to reject and terminate foreign forces' interference and obstructions to the internal issues of the Korean nation.
					
					 Therefore, the international community should extend unreserved support and encouragement to the Korean nation.
					
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, chairman of the Egyptian Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, in a statement on Jan. 8 said that there is no more vital task than national reunification for the Korean people at present.
					
					 The proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo clarified by President Kim Il Sung, the eternal leader of the Korean people, is the most fair and aboveboard and realistic proposal for the reunification of Korea, he stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Respond to DPRK's Proposal
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Respond to DPRK's Proposal
Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Austria and Democratic Congo expressed full support to the joint statement of the DPRK's government, political parties and organizations.
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna in a statement on Jan. 6 recalled that the joint statement proposed having wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations with the political parties and organizations of south Korea including its authorities.
					
					 Declaring that the organization would make positive efforts for the peace and reunification of the Korean Peninsula, it urged the authorities, political parties, organizations and personages of various strata in south Korea to positively respond to the DPRK's proposal.
					
					 The Group for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea of Democratic Congo in a statement on Jan. 10 demanded the south Korean authorities respond at an early date to the proposal to weather the present difficulties and usher in a new phase of peace and reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Bangladesh
Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- A Bangladeshi preparatory committee for celebrating General Secretary Kim Jong Il's birthday which falls on February 16 was inaugurated in Dhaka on Jan. 11.
					Garib Newaz, President of the Bangladesh People's League, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the inaugural ceremony.
					
					 The committee discussed and decided to organize diverse events including meeting, seminar and film show on that occasion.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Studied in Mexico
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint New Year Editorial Studied in Mexico
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- Reading sessions on the DPRK's joint New Year editorial were held by the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism and its branches and Youth Group and the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea on Jan. 6 and 7.
					 The joint editorial was read out and speeches were made there.
					
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, president of the above-said committee, said that the joint editorial serves as an important work as it clearly reflects leader Kim Jong Il's grandiose plan for building a great prosperous and powerful nation and the strategy and ways to implement it.
					
					 Juan Campos Vega, chairman of the above-said institute, expressed belief that the Korean people would accelerate the development of the light industry once again this year and thus bring about a decisive change in the improvement of the people's standard of living and the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Joint Statement Supported
articles.content:
DPRK's Joint Statement Supported
 Pyongyang, January 16 (KCNA) -- The joint statement of the DPRK government, political parties and organizations is a manifestation of the DPRK's patriotic stand and persevering effort, said Secouna Camara, director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea, addressing a meeting in Guinea on Jan. 10.
					 The joint statement was another important measure for settling the serious situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and between the north and the south and achieving national reunification as soon as possible, he noted, and continued: 
					
					 It is the consistent stand of the DPRK to improve the north-south relations, promote the national reconciliation and unity and open a decisive phase for the peace and the reunification of the peninsula through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 He expressed belief that a decisive phase will be opened for the peace and reunification of the peninsula if the north and the south promote reconciliation and unity and head for dialogue and negotiations in the idea of "By our nation itself."
